caption: The Louvre was really lovely. We didn‚Äôt have much time as we hand to travel to the airport so we made sure that we went in just to get a good view of the Mona Lisa and it was worth it!! The lines can be really long so it‚Äôs best you get there early or just be ready to stand in line but once it opened, the lines were moving quickly and you can then be on your way. It‚Äôs really beautiful and you probably would need the whole day to see everything,bee unfortunately just didn‚Äôt have the time.

I am blown away by everything I saw  Get there early Opens at 9:00 We were online by 8:30. Maybe #50 Go up to level 700 for the Mona Lisa immediately! We left about 11:45 There was an hour wait and 200-300 people outside waiting to get in  The artifacts and histori al value is unimaginable

In the afternoon of July 13, 2024, my wife and I came here again. I believe we liked the artistic contrast between the old and the new. We strived to take nice photos despite visitors were everywhere. I visited the museum more than once and I thought there was nothing new down under.

There are few places in the world more iconic than this one. I don't know of any. At first, I was quite unhappy with the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãmixing modern architecture with this 16th-17th century building, but over time I came to find it to be pure genius. I think not everyone will agree with me, and that's the beauty of it.

It was amazing to see that much crowd during Olympic restrictions.. beautiful place to visit at any time. Advance booking  tickets are highly recommended in case if you planning to visit the museum. Unfortunately fountain ‚õ≤Ô∏è were off but never mind next time ..

Nice court of the Louvre museum! All the time full of people. You can get inside the Louvre galleries, under the pyramid, for shopping souvenirs. Get the Carousel entrance. For the museum it‚Äôs another queue you have to get, 30‚Äô before your scheduled time.
Outside of Louvre experienced. First weekend of December 2024. Experiencing the magnificent architecture was glorious.

The iconic Louvre pyramid can be accessed in the square without purchase of a museum ticket (you see the top of the pyramid along with multiple mini pyramids near by). The square was very crowded when we visited midday on a weekday but beautiful views regardless!!

My wife and I went to the grounds of an evening. There was a lovely violinist playing and a gorgeous sunset. Very romantic. I have not been into the museum but I would recommend just visiting the area in the early evening as the sun is setting. Very beautiful
Great, get a tour to help guide you and explain key works. There are 4 main wings. A lot to see including Mona Lisa, Winged Nike, Venus d‚ÄôMilo, etc.
Simply amazing. Highly recommend riding a bike here and taking the scenic route along the Seine (which is immaculately clean after everything they did in  preparation for the Olympics).

Extremely busy, they should allocate a timeframe per booking and allow everyone to get the chance to see it.  I recommend buying your ticket in advance, get there at least 1hour-30min before your slot time to avoid disappointment. This place is always packed with people unless you wait for the open time and are the first to enter. Ticket costs ¬£63.69 for 2

Very nice experience, lots of steps.  Beautiful creations, beautiful works, the crown jewels, a pleasure for the eyes.  It takes around 2 hours to tour the museum, wear comfortable shoes as they are more suitable for walking.

The iconic Glass Pyramid, a centerpiece of the Louvre Museum in Paris, is a must-see attraction for any visitor. Its sleek design which also marks as the entrance to the museum and central location make it a popular spot for tourists to capture memorable photos. Unfortunately, due to a tight schedule, we missed the opportunity to experience its nighttime beauty. A return trip to the Louvre is definitely on my list.
Like it or loath it, this out of place, glass pyramid is the most unlikely entrance to probably the most famous museum in the world. The queues are always long, even in the rain.

Even though I didn‚Äôt go inside the Louvre Museum, stopping by to take photos of the front was still worthwhile. The grand building and the iconic glass pyramid make for fantastic photo opportunities. It‚Äôs also very easy to get to, with a nearby Metro station making the trip convenient. Visiting the exterior is definitely worth it, even if you don‚Äôt make it inside.

Buildings are absolutely huge in this area, we spotted a bike taxi guy having a pee in the enterance tunnel, but you gotta go when you gotta go right? It‚Äôs great for street photography. This area was very busy in general, but that‚Äôs to be expected.

The Louvre Museum is undoubtedly a highlight of Paris and a must visit destination for anyone traveling to the city. The museum iconic glass pyramid entrance is a striking sight, beautifully contrasting with the historic Louvre Palace. Inside, can explore an extensive collection of art and history, making it an unforgettable experience.

Tickets purchased on the official website cannot be successfully paid for, and it‚Äôs not possible to book any time before noon. Therefore, tickets can only be bought through an agency website. Reservations need to be made a week in advance, and the venue is open until 9 p.m. on Wednesdays and Fridays. Download the Louvre App and check the layout map in advance, then pick up a guidebook. The area to visit is very large. I walked more than ten kilometers in under eight hours. It‚Äôs necessary to plan the order of visiting several galleries and floors in advance.

The Louvre itself is a 10 billion euro building (with much more than that in contents). You don't have to go inside to appreciate it; and the Pyramid is a perfect example. Walk the grounds without any ticket needed. You DO need a ticket to enter the Pyramid and rest of the Louvre, though.
It's one of the most iconic places in Paris. Understandably it's incredibly crowded.  There's loads of pyramids to take a picture against. It's surrounded by this huge building (museum)

The Louvre Pyramid in Paris is a modern architectural masterpiece that serves as the main entrance to the Louvre Museum. It was designed by I.M. Pei, a renowned Chinese-American architect, and inaugurated in 1989.  Architecture and Designüëá  The pyramid is constructed from glass and metal and stands 21.6 meters (71 feet) high, with a square base measuring 35 meters (115 feet) on each side.  It is made of 603 rhombus-shaped and 70 triangular glass panes, creating a striking contrast between the classical Louvre palace and contemporary architecture.  The glass used was specially designed to ensure it was completely transparent, avoiding any visual distortion of the historic palace in reflections.  Controversy and Acceptance  Initially, the pyramid faced backlash from critics, who felt its modern design clashed with the Louvre‚Äôs historic aesthetic. Over time, however, it became a symbol of the museum‚Äôs fusion of tradition and modernity and a celebrated landmark.  Functionality  The pyramid marks the entrance to a large underground lobby that distributes visitors across different wings of the museum.  Beneath the pyramid lies the Inverted Pyramid, a smaller glass structure that draws light into the Carrousel du Louvre, a shopping mall and museum extension.  Symbolism and Legacy  The Louvre Pyramid represents more than just an entrance‚Äîits bold design symbolizes the dialogue between past and present in art and architecture, a philosophy that defines the Louvre Museum today.  It remains one of Paris‚Äôs most recognizable landmarks, featured in popular culture, including in The Da Vinci Code.
Amazing! Must buy tickets online before and arrive 20 minutes before the time slot so you aren‚Äôt waiting. Also try to avoid the pyramid entrance as it‚Äôs the busiest.
Stunning architecture and a must visit place in Paris. If you want to visit Louvre museum take a day time in hand. Visited in Aug 2024.

As a local guide I knew that this was not the famous step pyramid of amanhotep the third, but rather a glass pyramid constructed in the 21st century.  That being said, it is very nice and I took these pics for you to enjoy it.

One of the most iconic structures in Paris. This seemingly out-of-place- installation in the Louvre complex was at first met with harsh criticism because it clashes with the more traditional aesthetics of the museum.  It did not help that the designer of the pyramid is not French but Chinese-American.  From my point of view, it looks great and fantastique! Be sure to pose for a picture in this controversial structure. The vast intricate walls of the Louvre in itself is enough even the toughest of critics.
Too many people as expected, but a really good experience

The wait to get inside (even with tickets) was nothing like I've ever seen before. I recommend thag you arrive around 30+ minutes ahead of your timed entry, as even though we were 15 minutes early, the queue went half way around the pyramid!  Once inside, security was very quick and easy to get though and the queues immediately dissipated. There were many cafes and shops around!  We wandered through many hallways and took notice of many talented artists. Personally, I don't understand the hype around the Mona Lisa; it was almost A3 in size and the crowd in front of it was ridiculous.  There is so much brilliant paintings and statues in the Louvre, and it just upset me to see to many people rushing straight to the Mona Lisa and walking right out.

A must-see landmark! Historic Paris. I.M. Pei's architectural masterpiece complements the Louvre's classical beauty, creating an awe-inspiring entrance.  The pyramid's glass and steel harmonize with the surrounding stonework, inviting visitors to explore the world's most famous art museum.
absolutely amazing. Better prepare a day to visit. And go for the most famous mona lisa first. Lot of people line up for that one

It was really excellent and interesting. You have limited time to take photos with the Mona Lisa, but unlimited time to see more beautiful and interesting paintings and artworks. Just don't focus only on seeing the Mona Lisa and enjoy other works as well.

What a crazy experience even getting into the Louvre. You wait in a long line and then go into the glass pyramid. It‚Äôs incredible even seeing the inside of the building. It was an old castle essentially that they converted into a museum. Definitely plan to spend at least half of a day there as there is so much to see and multiple different wings.

Life changing experience walked 10 miles in 7 hours here. So much history ‚ù§Ô∏è get tickets online the line can be wrapped around the building! Make a reservation and a guide if you can afford it. Definitely plan your visit.

It‚Äôs the entrance to the Louvre Museum. It gets very very busy during the day. If you get there in the morning before 8.30 am there is almost no one there.  The mass of tourists during the day is very off putting.
It‚Äôs amazing place abd I can get enough and finally they complete the instructions , amazing üòª ‚Ä¶
Love this place! This time Visited without entering the museum
It's nice to see it during the evening. There are a lot is street musicians around that made the atmosphere really nice

It reflects great incompetence when you reserve your spot two days in advance, arrive on time, and still have to wait at least an hour under the burning sun, with no shade provided. The collection is worth seeing, but the Louvre administration deserves a 1-star rating for their poor management.
